reviews.review: Давным давно купил этот сырой кусок kaLLa, ждал развития. Всё, что туда завезли - это DLC с имбалансными убийцами. На этом всё. Теперь это сырой кусок kaLLa, с теми же вылетами, с теми же багами, с теми же аутизмами. Ни в коем случае не покупайте это, подумайте о своих нервах и потраченном времени без удовольствия.
I LIKE THE CONCEPT OF THE GAME

Игра мне нравится но в ней есть два момента которые бесят больше всего:
1 - это тупые тиммейты которые не могут прийти и помочь,они думают что они справятся и без 1 тиммейта.
2 - эта убийцы которые поджидают твоих тиммейтов у крюка на котором ты весишь
 На этом все

DBD: A review by me, because you should listen to me (Its my opinion). 
Why wouldn't you want to listen to me? 

Lets start off with my background on the game: I began with Dead by Daylight: Special Edition, on the console. A few buddies of mine played the game religiously when it first came out in 2016. I played it on free weekends with them and mostly as a party game. We played customs and nothing more. Then, In 2018, I bought the game and grinded 400 hours on console. I got pretty decent with "near-advanced" mechanics, but never played killer. I switched to PC, and have played 400 hours since August 2020. Achieving rank 1 on each side. 

Introduction: Beginning the game or learning the game, is when it is the most fun. I have taught new friends the game over the years, and that peaceful concept of being so scared of a killer (for no reason) is what puts a charm on DBD. I miss the immersion of being a new player, and love seeing new players experience it. It keeps me playing the game, and it is a lot more enjoyable when teaching someone who is close to you. HOWEVER! Once you reach outside of 100-150 hours the game can become incredibly frustrating and lose its initial taste. The "killer realization virginity," as I like to call it, is robbed from new players. This realization creates a nullification that the game was ever creepy-- basically making matches a generator tycoon, or chase-based game. Which in itself if the premises of the game. Yet, I wouldn't have a problem with that except each match after your realize this becomes consecutively more boring. A common counter to this is that if you play both sides of the game (killer and survivor) the game becomes a lot more versatile and interesting. I 100% agree with you to an extent, but the game still gets dull after a while. Yes!! You can still have fun with the game, but most players must fulfill specific requirements in order to achieve this. Such as playing with friends, not getting tunneled, requiring chases each match, only wanting specific killers to play against, bullying others, etc. 

Mechanics: The mechanics of the game I generally have no problem with. Yes, some people have bad internet, that's a problem but you cant change that. Pallet loops and windows have their strengths and weaknesses. Its up to the better player to win the match-up in that aspect. However, some loops are downright unfair. Specific windows create too much of a gap between a survivor and killer, and that can change an entire game. Breakable doors are a great solution and interesting to have in the game, but need to be more game-defining. Over the years mechanics have become a lot better, and I have less complaints than what I would of had this time two years ago. 

Perks: Hate that exhaustion perks are go to in every single game, but its a good concept in theory. The only perk I ever have a problem with is (you guessed it) decisive strike. DS is the arguably the most controversial perk in the game. To start off, it has a guessing game whether or not a survivor has it. If a survivor has it, the killer is presented with the same dilemma. "Do I eat a 5 second stun causing more loops, or do I wait 60 seconds?" Four times per game at high ranks. That's the only perk I hate, others have actual counter-play. Because remember! Each side has perks. 

Items: They are pretty balanced now so I have no problem with them.

Offerings: Offerings are cool! Besides map offerings. The idea of selecting map in theory is cool. Who wouldn't want to play on their favorite killer DLC map? However, some killers are not powerful on specific maps. I.e. Old Ormond or Lampkin Lane. Hopefully the Lampkin Lane issue is resolved soon!

Conclusion: The game has improved over the years! But still feels like a 2016 game. I love that the game is fun to play for a while and is pretty diverse with each side. Plus, what other options do you have for an asymmetrical killer game? The concept of the game as a whole is great and I believe it takes certain people to love it! Yet, like every game (this one more than others) needs work. 

Also the creators could be nicer to their community and play their game to understand our perspective!!

ok this game has gotten better but there are still some problems that have ruined some of my matches such as being stuck on a hook and not being able to get taken off which is why I would say buy it if you want.

Bought the game at 50% off, at first it was terrifying to play 'cause it's obviously a Horror Survival Game but as I played it more and more, I've gotten used to it by now. I've discovered that it is more than a Horror  Game, I've had the laughs and enjoyment while playing this game cause they honestly did a good job giving players a taste of suspense and satisfaction when you do objectives successfully.

Bad hitboxes other than that pre gooood

It's an amazing game if you have discord and can just chat with friends, Whether it's talking to know what killer it is you can also let each other know where he/she is etc. 

The game has no voice communication only chat based communication before game (pre lobby) and efter game (in post lobby). Instead what you can do is press 1 for point or 2 for come here gesture with the character. 

A lot of small nuances that you have to learn. Plenty of perk builds very good grinding game. You can unlock every character on both killer and survivor side without paying extra money for dlc if you want to. But everything but newest dlcs are on 75% sale just like this game is on most events like autumn sale or winter sale for example.
nice game but plis make the match making more faster if we be a killer

This is the best game... im just amazed at how good this good is!!..

Has the potential to be such a great game but it's plagued by many technical issues further exacerbated by the god awful dedicated servers implemented; still living due to lack of any real competition which has allowed the devs to effectively ignore issues like hit boxes, general imbalance etc. Love the idea of having all these horror icons alongside some cool original characters in this simple but generally solid game play loop, but it's really difficult to recommend in its current state.

Where does one even start with this... it's awesome, its a broken shitshow, the devs try to make it fun as much as they can yet they fail miserably at so many things, the game represents the decade very well. I enjoyed almost every hour of this game because i decided to not be miserable and salty about losses or bugs but if you're a person that doesn't like people disconnecting from matches and runining your game or salty russians or arabs saying they made sweet love to your mom in their own language after they won or lost, maybe this isn't the game for you, tho if you like to meet awesome people that you might become friends with, people that might make you enjoy life more, try this game 100%. What Dead by Daylight does right is short matches with many different people that lets you enjoy the game in many ways. The constant updates will keep you from ever being bored. All in all, you want to waste time feeling scared at first and eventually like you're competing in a game of death and survival, get this game, or don't, i aint yo dad, do watchu want.
